abstract: One of JPMorgan’s top deal makers in China is retiring. | Herbalife is allowing Carl C. Icahn to nominate three more board representatives. | Regulatory changes have been slow to take hold at credit rating agencies. | Pimco has been attracting attention for the wrong reasons. | The Silk Road case began with a hunt for “John Doe.”
snippet: One of JPMorgan’s top deal makers in China is retiring. | Herbalife is allowing Carl C. Icahn to nominate three more board representatives. | Regulatory changes have been slow to take hold at credit rating agencies. | Pimco has been attracting att...
lead_paragraph: Fang Fang, one of JPMorgan Chase’s top deal makers in China and a focus of the United States government’s investigation into the bank’s hiring practices in China, is resigning, Neil Gough writes in DealBook. Mr. Fang announced his decision in an internal memo sent to employees on Monday.

headline.main: A Top JPMorgan Banker Is Departing
